clinical_study.brief_title: Safety and Gastrointestinal Effects of Intravenous Methylnaltrexone
clinical_study.official_title: Safety and Gastrointestinal Effects of Multiple-Dosed Intravenous Methylnaltrexone in Healthy Human Volunteers

brief_summary.textblock: This study evaluates the safety of multiple doses of IV MNTX in normal healthy adults.

primary_outcome.measure: Peak Plasma Concentration of IV MNTX
primary_outcome.description: To evaluate plasma pharmacokinetics of multiple-doses of intravenous methylnaltrexone in healthy human volunteers.

secondary_outcome.measure: Time to Maximum Plasma Concentration of IV MNTX
secondary_outcome.description: To evaluate plasma pharmacokinetics of multiple-doses of intravenous methylnaltrexone in healthy human volunteers.
To evaluate plasma pharmacokinetics of multiple-doses of intravenous methylnaltrexone in healthy human volunteers.
To evaluate plasma pharmacokinetics of multiple-doses of intravenous methylnaltrexone in healthy human volunteers.

secondary_outcome.measure: Volume of Distribution of IV MNTX
secondary_outcome.description: To evaluate plasma pharmacokinetics of multiple-doses of intravenous methylnaltrexone in healthy human volunteers.

secondary_outcome.measure: Area Under the Plasma Concentration versus Time Curve (AUC) of IV MNTX
secondary_outcome.description: To evaluate plasma pharmacokinetics of multiple-doses of intravenous methylnaltrexone in healthy human volunteers.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of IV MNTX Excreted in Urine
secondary_outcome.description: To evaluate plasma pharmacokinetics of multiple-doses of intravenous methylnaltrexone in healthy human volunteers.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Must be male or non-pregnant female volunteers
2. Must be 18 to 65 yrs of age
3. Must have no significant active disease states
Exclusion Criteria:
1. History or current evidence of disease (cardiovascular, respiratory, endocrine, renal, hepatic, hematological, or psychiatric)
2. Illicit drug users
3. Subjects who received an experimental new drug in the past 30 days
4. Subjects with any laboratory findings outside normal limits
